comments:
Using the TPTP-4.4.0-200706140100 build, the following exception is written to the Eclipse log when opening the Resource Perspective:

!MESSAGE Exception in org.eclipse.ui.internal.PageLayout.addView: org.eclipse.ui.PartInitException: Could not create view: org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.ui.explorer.internal.ui.MRExplorerView

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-06-15 13:04:33.171
!MESSAGE Could not create view: org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.ui.explorer.internal.ui.MRExplorerView

Note, I used the All-in-one package on a Windows 2000 machine with IBM JRE 1.5 SR4 to reproduce this problem.
This needs to be investigated to determine the cause.  Making it a P1 priority for now.
This also happens with the TPTP-4.4.0-200706070100 build.

Note, the problem happens with TPTP 4.3.1 as well.  Since this is not a regression in 4.4 and it doesn't appear to have any effects on the Resource Perspective, I don't consider this a stop ship issue for TPTP 4.4. I will make it a candidate for the 4.4.1 fix pack.
Adding Steve to cc list as he originally reported this problem.

Can a workaround be created to stop the error from getting written to the log? The resource perspective is pretty common and this is a big scary stack trace for people to find growing in their .log file.

Created an attachment (id=71509)
Remove the resource perspective extension
Can we get this fixed in a supported patch before the TPTP 4.4.1 fix pack.  The exception written to the log file does not provide a good user experience if they look at the .log file.
This was approved by TPTP PMC for inclusion in TPTP 4.4.0.1 patch release.  I have committed the fix to TPTP Head CVS on behalf of Balan.

Verified that this has been fixed with the TPTP 4.4.0.1 features available on the TPTP update site.  I installed Eclipse 3.3 and then TPTP from the Europa Discovery site.  Then I updated the TPTP features from the TPTP update site and the problem did not occur.
*** Bug 197915 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
